channel.title: Comments on: It's All About Audience

item.description: […] User testing, anecdotal evidence, probably some of your own experiences, and feedback from both LibQUAL 2013 and LibQUAL 2015 tell us that our patrons have too hard a time finding what they need on our […]

item.title: By: Muinat Amin
item.dc:creator: Muinat Amin
item.description:
Michele -
Great blog post on the library's target audience. I am curious to know when and how the numbers were pulled for the info graphic? This is information will come in handy for my initial assessment of the Library. Thank you!
item.content:encoded:
Michele –

Great blog post on the library’s target audience. I am curious to know when and how the numbers were pulled for the info graphic? This is information will come in handy for my initial assessment of the Library. Thank you!

item.title: By: Michele Mizejewski
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/04/04/its-all-about-audience/#comment-224">Gail Persily</a>.
Good point Gail. You can share links from this blog, but they are hidden from search engines, since it's primarily an internal discussion. I posted something similar on an outward-facing public blog which will enable discovery by others: https://blogs.library.ucsf.edu/ckm/2014/04/11/its-all-about-audience/
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gail Persily.

Good point Gail. You can share links from this blog, but they are hidden from search engines, since it’s primarily an internal discussion. I posted something similar on an outward-facing public blog which will enable discovery by others: https://blogs.library.ucsf.edu/ckm/2014/04/11/its-all-about-audience/

item.title: By: Gail Persily
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description: Really interesting - I like the info graphic on the audiences. I wonder if some of this content should be public rather than just for Library staff. Also, other colleagues in the biz would find it interesting.
item.content:encoded: Really interesting – I like the info graphic on the audiences. I wonder if some of this content should be public rather than just for Library staff. Also, other colleagues in the biz would find it interesting.
